alarms.quick_fix: Reduce feedrate, check for mechanical binding

fix_procedures.action: Reduce feed override to 50% and retry
Check axis for mechanical binding — manually jog each axis slowly
Inspect servo motor cables for damage, loose connections
Check servo amplifier LEDs for fault codes
Measure motor insulation resistance (should be >1 MΩ)
Verify servo parameters match motor specs (Ke, Kt, inertia ratio)

alarms.description: X axis servo fuse has blown

fix_procedures.action: Power off machine completely and lock out
Locate and replace blown fuse with correct rating
Check motor insulation resistance before re-energizing
If fuse blows again, disconnect motor and test drive separately
Inspect motor windings for shorts — replace motor if resistance is low

alarms.description: Y axis servo fuse has blown

fix_procedures.action: Power off machine completely and lock out
Locate and replace blown fuse with correct rating
Check motor insulation resistance before re-energizing
If fuse blows again, disconnect motor and test drive separately
Inspect motor windings for shorts — replace motor if resistance is low

alarms.description: Z axis servo fuse has blown

Locate and replace blown fuse with correct rating
Check motor insulation resistance before re-energizing
If fuse blows again, disconnect motor and test drive separately
Inspect motor windings for shorts — replace motor if resistance is low

alarms.description: X axis following error exceeded limit

fix_procedures.action: Home the affected axis
Check for chip buildup on linear scales or encoder
Clean scale read head and verify gap distance
Inspect coupling between motor and ballscrew
Check ballscrew backlash with dial indicator
Verify encoder signals with oscilloscope (clean sine/cosine)
